FY22 RAILROAD SAFETY STATE PARTICIPATION GRANT   IN

TRAINING FOR EMERGENCY RESPONDERS, EMERGENCY MEDICAL TECHNICIANS, POLICE FIRE PERSONNEL, ETC  OF TANK CAR NOMENCLATURE, RAILROAD OPERATIONS AND OTHER RELATED MATTERS USEFUL TO MITIGATE RAILROAD EMERGENCIES

THIS GRANT IS IN SUPPORT OF OLI ADMINISTRATION OF A PUBLIC INFORMATION AND EDUCATION AND AWARENESS PROGRAMS TO HELP PREVENT AND REDUCE PEDESTRIAN, MOTOR VEHICLE, AND OTHER ACCIDENTS, INCIDENTS, INJURIES, AND FATALITIES, AND TO IMPROVE AWARENESS ALONG RAILROAD RIGHTS OF WAY AND AT HIGHWAY RAIL GRADE CROSSINGS IN THE UNITED STATES

THE PROJECT WILL FUND SAFETY MESSAGING, OUTREACH MATERIALS, AND EXTRA EDUCATION AND OUTREACH BY SMART?S CODE COMPLIANCE OFFICERS AND ITS COMMUNITY-WIDE SUICIDE PREVENTION COALITION ALONG SMART?S RAILROAD AND PATHWAY INFRASTRUCTURE IN SONOMA AND MARIN COUNTIES, CA. SPECIFICALLY, THE MATERIALS WILL INCLUDE ONBOARD HANDOUTS AND FLYERS, TRACK SIGNAGE, AND SUPPORT FOR GENERAL PUBLIC AWARENESS OUTREACH THROUGH RADIO AND OTHER MEDIA REGARDING RAIL-RELATED SUICIDE AND PREVENTION. THESE EFFORTS WILL BUILD ON SMART?S EXISTING SUICIDE AWARENESS PROGRAM FOCUSED ON PREVENTION, EDUCATION AND ENFORCEMENT AS A THREE-PRONGED APPROACH TO ADDRESSING THIS ISSUE.
